protocol_name: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
protocol_name_html: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
guidelines:
PFGE Protocol is from Griffith 2000

PFGE Modifications (Schwalbach 2002): 
- 1% Seakem Gold agarose gels are used. Gel is poured after it has cooled to below 45°C.
- Instead of using 1:10 TE for the 3 microcon rinses, regular TE (pH 7.6) is used.
- For the final collection of viruses from microcons use two 240 x g spins with 10 μl of TE each spin instead of one 5 minute 1000 x g spin with 20 μl 0.5x TBE. 
- NEB PFGE standards are occasionally used, though liquid lambda/5 kb ladders are also used.
- Gels are destained in diH2O for minimum of 30 minutes. 
- Should use the majority of the 150 and 500 m samples. (i.e. all of it)

components.data: A 15-20 liter natural seawater sample is passed through a glass fiber pre-filter (Gelman A/E) and a 0.22 μm pore size membrane (Durapore, Millipore).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: A 15-20 liter natural seawater sample is passed through a glass fiber pre-filter (Gelman A/E) and a 0.22 μm pore size membrane (Durapore, Millipore).

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.protocol_name: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.annotation: During this and each subsequent step, the sample should be kept as cold as possible.
source_data.thread_text: During this and each subsequent step, the sample should be kept as cold as possible.
source_data.body: During this and each subsequent step, the sample should be kept as cold as possible.

components.data: Concentrate to ca. 150-200 ml using 30 kD MWC Spiral Cartridge Concentrator (SCC).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Concentrate to ca. 150-200 ml using 30 kD MWC Spiral Cartridge Concentrator (SCC).

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.protocol_name: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.annotation: If a large volume has been concentrated, there is no need to flush the unit, as this increases (numerical) yield of virus by < 5%, and increases the time needed to complete the next step significantly.
source_data.thread_text: If a large volume has been concentrated, there is no need to flush the unit, as this increases (numerical) yield of virus by < 5%, and increases the time needed to complete the next step significantly.
source_data.body: If a large volume has been concentrated, there is no need to flush the unit, as this increases (numerical) yield of virus by < 5%, and increases the time needed to complete the next step significantly.

components.data: Transfer the SCC retentate to Centriprep 30’s.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the SCC retentate to Centriprep 30’s.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.protocol_name: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.annotation: These can initially be filled to about 2 cm past the mark on their barrels to save handling time.
source_data.thread_text: These can initially be filled to about 2 cm past the mark on their barrels to save handling time.
source_data.body: These can initially be filled to about 2 cm past the mark on their barrels to save handling time.

components.data: Store balance of concentrate in refrigerator.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store balance of concentrate in refrigerator.

components.data: Centrifuge in IEC-HN SE II at full speed for 15 minutes (in refrigerator if possible).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge in IEC-HN SE II at full speed for 15 minutes (in refrigerator if possible).

components.data: Empty central reservoir without refilling and repeat centrifugation step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Empty central reservoir without refilling and repeat centrifugation step.

components.data: Empty and refill keeping volumes equal in order to maximize filtration area of Centripreps and balance rotor.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Empty and refill keeping volumes equal in order to maximize filtration area of Centripreps and balance rotor.

components.data: Continue to spin and empty until no more water enters central chamber.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Continue to spin and empty until no more water enters central chamber.

components.data: Remove central insert from 2 of units, replace caps, and spin retentate chamber briefly to recover droplets from sides.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove central insert from 2 of units, replace caps, and spin retentate chamber briefly to recover droplets from sides.

components.data: Combine retentate into 2, and finally one Centriprep unit, by gentle pipetting.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Combine retentate into 2, and finally one Centriprep unit, by gentle pipetting.

components.data: When all have been combined and spun, the final volume is ca. 500 μl.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When all have been combined and spun, the final volume is ca. 500 μl.

components.data: Make a 1% agarose gel by combining 1 g Bio-Rad Molecular Grade Agarose with 99ml 0.5x TBE, and heating until completely clear of unmelted material.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make a 1% agarose gel by combining 1 g Bio-Rad Molecular Grade Agarose with 99ml 0.5x TBE, and heating until completely clear of unmelted material.

components.data: Preparing Electrophoresis Chamber
components.name: Section

components.data: Assemble mold with backing plate in place and pour in liquid.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Assemble mold with backing plate in place and pour in liquid.

components.data: Preparing Electrophoresis Chamber
components.name: Section

components.data: Let set.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let set.

components.data: Preparing Electrophoresis Chamber
components.name: Section

components.data: Meanwhile, fill electrophoresis chamber with 2 liters 0.5x TBE.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Meanwhile, fill electrophoresis chamber with 2 liters 0.5x TBE.

components.data: Preparing Electrophoresis Chamber
components.name: Section

components.data: Turn on pump and chiller, and set temperature to 14°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn on pump and chiller, and set temperature to 14°C.

components.data: Preparing Electrophoresis Chamber
components.name: Section

components.data: When gel is set, remove comb and sides of mold, and slide backing plate, with gel attached, out of mold.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When gel is set, remove comb and sides of mold, and slide backing plate, with gel attached, out of mold.

components.data: Preparing Electrophoresis Chamber
components.name: Section

components.data: Place gel with backing plate into receiver in electrophoresis chamber, taking care not to dislodge gel from plate, with wells in rear and let chill.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place gel with backing plate into receiver in electrophoresis chamber, taking care not to dislodge gel from plate, with wells in rear and let chill.

components.data: Preparing Electrophoresis Chamber
components.name: Section

components.data: Transfer aliquots into Microcons (30 or 100 kD MWC).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer aliquots into Microcons (30 or 100 kD MWC).

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 19 of Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.protocol_name: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.annotation: To obtain full detail of banding, a range of aliquots should be used until the sampling location has been well characterized. This range can then be narrowed.
source_data.thread_text: To obtain full detail of banding, a range of aliquots should be used until the sampling location has been well characterized. This range can then be narrowed.
source_data.body: To obtain full detail of banding, a range of aliquots should be used until the sampling location has been well characterized. This range can then be narrowed.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 19 of Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.protocol_name: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protocol for Pulsed Field Gel Electrophoresis
source_data.annotation: Suggested volumes from 20 liter starting volume are 50, 100, 150 and 200 μl.
source_data.thread_text: Suggested volumes from 20 liter starting volume are 50, 100, 150 and 200 μl.
source_data.body: Suggested volumes from 20 liter starting volume are 50, 100, 150 and 200 μl.

components.data: Place each aliquot in a separate Microcon an spin at 1000 x g for 20 minutes (about 4000 RPM in Eppendorf Microfuge) to near dryness (most of the Microcon membrane is dry, and only a small ring of liquid remains around edge).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place each aliquot in a separate Microcon an spin at 1000 x g for 20 minutes (about 4000 RPM in Eppendorf Microfuge) to near dryness (most of the Microcon membrane is dry, and only a small ring of liquid remains around edge).

components.data: As they reach the proper volume, smaller volume aliquots can be removed and stored in the refrigerator until the larger have been  reduced to the proper volume.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: As they reach the proper volume, smaller volume aliquots can be removed and stored in the refrigerator until the larger have been  reduced to the proper volume.

components.data: When all samples have been reduced, add 50 μl 1:10 TE to each tube, taking care not to touch membrane with pipette tip, and spin again to reduce volume as described above.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When all samples have been reduced, add 50 μl 1:10 TE to each tube, taking care not to touch membrane with pipette tip, and spin again to reduce volume as described above.

components.data: Repeat step 22.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat step 22.

components.data: Repeat step 22 again.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat step 22 again.

components.data: Now add 20 μl 0.5x TBE to membrane to elute viruses, again taking care not to touch membrane.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Now add 20 μl 0.5x TBE to membrane to elute viruses, again taking care not to touch membrane.

components.data: Invert cartridge, place in fresh tube, and spin for 5 minutes at 1000 x g to recover.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Invert cartridge, place in fresh tube, and spin for 5 minutes at 1000 x g to recover.

components.data: Place tubes containing recovered viruses in 60°C water bath for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place tubes containing recovered viruses in 60°C water bath for 10 minutes.

components.data: Remove tubes and place immediately on ice for 2 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove tubes and place immediately on ice for 2 minutes.

components.data: Transfer to microfuge and spin briefly to recover condensation from walls of tubes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer to microfuge and spin briefly to recover condensation from walls of tubes.

components.data: Prepare molecular weight markers by combining 100-200 ng of marker stock to 0.5x TBE to a final volume of 20 μl.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare molecular weight markers by combining 100-200 ng of marker stock to 0.5x TBE to a final volume of 20 μl.

components.data: Add 10 μl PFGE loading buffer to each tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 10 μl PFGE loading buffer to each tube.

components.data: Mix by simultaneously inverting several times slowly, while rolling between index finger and thumb.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix by simultaneously inverting several times slowly, while rolling between index finger and thumb.

components.data: Turn chiller and pump off.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn chiller and pump off.
